review: Omg!! I can't believe they opened a Red Robin near me. This is my favorite burger place. Ultimate favorite? Their turkey burger and their endless seasoned fries ! Raspberry iced tea is a must try.

We where in for their trial run before the opening of the restaurant. 12-17-2016 the food was very good. Our waitress debbie was very nice gave all the information about the new restaurant, rewards card, menu etc.. the food servers still a little confused about what table the food is going ( just getting to know the table #'s) the wait for food was not very long for a trail run..good job. We will definitely go back..

This location just opened today. Looks like they were well prepared. I've been to many Red Robin's and have been hoping a location north of Boston would open. This one didn't disappoint. Will visit again soon with family

I was super stoked when I saw that we were getting a Red Robin in Woburn and I was really excited to visit today. I've been to Red Robin once before, but this experience was not what I hoped it would be. Our server was absolutely lovely and the restaurant had an awesome atmosphere and overall great staff, but our food was pretty terrible. My boyfriend got "wings", which were essentially chicken nuggets with a pretty nasty sauce on them. I ended up getting the G.D.B., which sounded really good on paper, but was actually pretty disgusting. Willing to try the location again and order a different item, but overall pretty disappointed.

Went on 12/21 for dinner as they just opened to the public 2 days earlier.  We were seated almost immediately, but the wait staff didn't show up for almost 15 mins.. I think that they forgot about us.  Once I flagged somebody down, the rest of the meal was on-time, and they were attentive.  I will chalk this up to opening week and working out the kinks. I have been to the locations in Nashua NH as well as the one in Foxborough, MA.  This experience was very similar  - the burger was very good, and the unlimited fries was a bonus.  I love that they will put a fried egg (or numerous other toppings) on your burger if you want.  My kids enjoyed the kids menu as there were lots of choices. I much prefer this experience versus going to Five Guys or WuBurger or B.Good as all of those are counter service... Another counter service one is Bobby Flay Burger Palace in the Burlington Mall.  I enjoy Bobby Flay's as it is a very trendy and hipster vibe to it, but just not the same as a sit down place with waiter service.   The closest competition I would see would be Johnny Rockets in Burlington MA but that isn't as good,   Another similar feeling place might be Dave & Buster's in Woburn but boy is it loud in there with the focus on arcade games versus food.   So, of all of these places, I would pick Red Robin if you are hankering for a really good burger with lots of choices/varieties.

Red Robin on the South Shore happens to be one of my daughter's favorite burger place. So when we found out that a new one opened in Woburn, we were very excited to try it out. Unfortunately, it was really disappointing. First, the wait was originally 20 minutes which turned into a 40-minute wait, not sure why since the place was half empty. We sat at a high tables and order drinks which were a 20minute wait and it took us asking 3 times to get water for the table.  Finally, when they sat us at the table and the food came, it was incredibly salty, and I like salty, but could only take a couple of bites. So the food was not the greatest but the service was even worse! We got the wrong dishes a couple of times and waited a long time for drinks, we even had to share napkins because they didn't bring enough to the table.  This is a new place and I'm not sure if they are still in training mode, but there is no reason for the food not to be consistent from place to place.  We will not be going back here anytime soon.

Came here on a Friday while driving to New Hampshire. We didn't realize that this location recently opened until we browsed other yelp reviews. The restaurant was clean and maintained well. When we walked into a half empty restaurant around 3pm, the hostess wanted to sit us next to another occupied table when there were at least ten other open tables. When I asked if we could instead get a one of two open booths, they said no. So finally they gave in and let us sit at a table next to the window. Come on red Robin, your restaurant is more than half empty and I would rather have a little privacy while I eat. Please don't sit groups right next to one another. The dining experience here is about different than other restaurants. Each table has this little tablet where you can order drinks, apps, call the server, and pay your bill (it even prints your receipt). It's pretty cool, but I really hope they clean that touchscreen.  Ok on to the food, we ordered the keep it simple and the big ghost with endless broccoli and garlic parmesan fries. The burger was pretty standard. The big ghost was too greasy with fried jalapenos inside. It actually wasn't that spicy. There are two versions - the big ghost and fiery tavern. Our waitress charged us for the big ghost ($2 more) but we weren't sure what the difference was. The sad broccoli was frozen and tasted like mush. The garlic parmesan fries were soaked with grease - it was really unpleasant to see and eat. When we asked our waitress for just regular fries, she said the garlic ones were already made. So we left the basket untouched since it was greasier than the time before. It was disappointing that she didn't want to just put another order in. Paying time. So we swiped our card at our table tablet and selected tip. We wanted to get water before leaving so we tried to call our waitress from the table but she was no where to be found. We ended up just walking to the bar and got our water refilled as we stood there awkwardly.  Overall, this red Robin location was OK. We think there are some improvements on service and food that should be made.

Yummy...great waitress Jenn she was so sweet...wasn't crowded for Xmas eve day at lunch which was nice!!! The front of the house needs some work as they were a bit clueless and it came across as rude...but the food was fast and hot...bottomless fries and lemonade was fun!  We got free games too so we played trivia while waiting!  I recommend this place for a quick bite!!!

These guys make fabulous burges.. the onion rings were awesome too I got the short stack. I was a bit disappointed they weren't doing milkshakes yet. But I grabbed a seat at the bar,  Try grabbing a seat at the bar if you can to get in quicker. The wait is pretty crazy right now due to Christmas break and that the location just opened. the corporate trainer manager is still on site  as of 12/30/2016 .  So just be prepared to wait a bit right now. it should get better wait times once the kids go back to school and such and the opening week stuff dies off. Overall its a good place. Judy and Co. at the bar are awesome and both are local gals. The bar has nice selection of beer and wines...vodka etc. and tv's. Plenty of booths nad plenty of parking. Right close to the Washington St. Exit off 128 .....about 10 min down the highway from the movie theater 15 from Burlington Mall. 10 from Stoneham Redstone shopping center area . 20 from Wakefield.Lynnfield. North shore./Salem area. depends on Boston traffic of course. Service was a bit slow but I understood it was opening week so they are still learning and it will pick up as the waitresses learn the menu and they learn everything. its a learning experience for everyone so give it a few weeks to iron things out and it will be fine. The same thing happened at the black horse tavern when it opened in Winchester took ema year or two to get going and iron things out and then it took off. Same will happen with Red Robin give it time The food is delicious though  and affordable and I will be back. Overalll its a great alternative to the mall or a good place to go on the way to the movie at Showcase Woburn or AMC burlington =)  Expect to wait a bit especially this next week or so with the opening week and vacation week. and during Feb break for two weeks when the kids are off of school it will be jammed again. Go betwen jan 2nd and Feb break and you should be fine.  The bartender told me it dies off after 3pm and picks up again around 5pm so in between during rush hour commute would be a good time to come in. Enjoy Reeeeeeeed Robin .............Yum!

I'm gonna give them the benefit of the doubt concerning service and say they're still probably working out the kinks. This is my favorite franchise and unfortunately the Woburn chef/cooks haven't seemed to have mastered the melt in your mouth effect you get from the other locations. Fingers crossed that they'll figure it out real soon. I'll keep you posted.
I've been to this branch twice and in both times, the food was ok- but the service was bad. The waitresses are slow, talk way too much and frankly made the experience bad. I wouldn't go back again.

One star because the waitress was ok.  The problem was, was that I ordered a chocolate malt.  I let the waitress know they had given me the wrong one.  She did acknowledge that the person who made it, did make a mistake. She brought out my correct order,  but half only in one of the silver cups where they usually put the excess.  That was it.  Also, I had a sandwich and the sides of the bread were hard as a rock.  We then ordered a refill on the kids meal which the kitchen got confused and took forever to come out.  The manager delivered it and just said..."sorry about that."  Nothing else.  This is fine, but I feel they should have at least offered the malt at no cost.  Very disappointing experience although I know they have recently opened.

The Burgers and fries are okay.  The service however is just horrible.  This seems to be the case with most new restaurants.   It seemed that the waitress had not been a waitress very long.  No smile, no real welcome...   We asked for two minutes to look at the menu and then we didn't see her again for 15 minutes. We showed up at 11:45am, so it was not very busy yet. It is a fairly big restaurant but they seemed to seat everyone with kids, or maybe just everyone, in the same area which made it extra hectic and loud in our section, even tough I was able to stare at a completely empty section just ten feet away.       Anyway, the food was okay and not too expensive.   But there are a lot of other places with good burgers and fries around, where the service will be much better.  My recommendation: give this place a few months so the wait staff, hostesses and management get some experience.   Otherwise, be prepared to be aggravated... Personally, I doubt we will go back.  Judging from the other reviews, the way they seat everyone together seems to be the way they do things.  With two kids, you just need some space.

This is an easy place to get to from most directions.  Newly opened, still working on bugs & people skills.  That'll come around soon enough.  Service time needs to pick up for the lunch crowd.  Think 15 mins to & from, 30 mins to eat for most. It's gonna go nuts here soon cause the food is really good.  Watch the apps or you may not finish your burger. Fries comes with the burger so don't do the app, onion rings are illegal & come large or small.  Our server today was great but seemed overwhelmed.  Nice alcohol choices. We also like the idea of 2 person booths at the back. Check their menu before you go to save time.  To the help, work on it it'll be a good experience.  The 5th star will come I'm sure.

The hostess had no idea what she was doing, she took us to the table and then ran back up front to make sure it was the right table because it was wet. She came back with some towels and dried the table and we sat down. Out waiter seemed like he had never been a waiter before (angel was his name,hard to forget) we ordered and our appatizer came out after out food did. For an appatizer we got the boneless wings with the buzz sauce and we asked our waiter what each sauce was and he had no idea and no willingness to go find out either. So when it came out it had Blu cheese potato chips and celery sticks mixed in with it...Neither of us like Blu cheese so those didn't really get eaten, the burgers were good and by the time he brought out a refill we noticed something floating in the drink...We payed and left,my boyfriend was irritated and vowed he wouldn't return!

One of the worst experiences ever! We arrived and it took 25 min to get our food.  My sons grilled cheese wasn't cooked, my mother ordered mac n cheese and it arrived freezing cold. The manager was quite apologetic and comped the whole meal which is the only reason I am giving a star. They won't survive like this.

I know this location is new and maybe they are working out kinks but the service has to improve!  My family,  party of four,  went at 4:30 on a Sunday and NOT one aspect of the meal was correct!  Waited 15 min to be greeted by our server and then at least another 20 minutes for the drinks to arrive. I won't even continue.  As they say, the rest is history!!  Will not return.

If I could give it a negative star in would. 1st we order a root beer float the root beer came but it took almost 10 minutes for the ice cream.  2nd we order ice tea with lemon and spenda, it came with neither. Waiter said they were out of lemons. A few minutes later a table next to ours were brought water with lemon. Had to go to the bad to get my own Lemon. 3rd order a bacon cheeseburger totally plain, it came with lettuce, tomato and mayo. Sent it back and again asked for splenda, manager come back with cheeseburger again asked for Splenda he brings back spenda as I go to put ketchup on my bacon cheeseburger I noticed all they did was give me a new roll and put the same cheeseburger on new rolled but some of the shredded lettuce was still stuck to the cheese. When I mentioned it to the manager his comment was i didn't notice it. Really, I wouldn't recommend red Robin to anyone. This was my first and absolutely my last. The worst part of the ordeal was the manager was just a matter of factly had nothing to say about the whole ordeal!!!!!!

i went for my first time ever and i have to say the food was good, real good. the drinks were pretty weak, like watered down rum using a small jig weak. so needless to say my mojito had no flavor.  the restaurant was mildly busy but not enough for our server to never be around.  i would most likely return to this location but won't order drinks.

I went here a few days ago and the burgers are awesome.  I paid extra for the garlic fries but are well worth it.  The prices are great or even less than the competitors.  And the waitress was a sweetheart.

First visit was fabulous our server was Joey who is phenomenal. Great personality helped with setting us up with reward program.  He is an asset to the company. Burgers were yummy. Managers came by twice to greet an make sure we were taken care of an satisfied. Only opened a month yet operated like they were there for years. Great job Red Robin Good Luck!!

Took a long  time to get served (burgers & milkshakes). Food, once served, was room temp at best. Voiced our concerns to manager and were comped our food. Might try again in a year or so after kinks are worked out. Side note - fried pickles & onions rings were tasty.

3.5 stars for the food, negative stars for the service.  I've been waiting for a while for this Red Robin to open and read the yelp reviews so I thought I was prepared for the bad service... not so much.  The service, although friendly,  was a disaster.  Where do we start?  The bar was so dirty with ton of used, empty glasses that were not cleared, but just pushed aside for people to sit or maybe the long long wait to get a drink sitting at the bar (more than 10 minutes to get acknowledged)? Or maybe the fact that they did not even have any clean glassware at the bar (probably because it was not being cleared) and had to go into the back to get a wine glass? Seriously not a good impression.  Then after waiting... our table was given away.... They ask for your phone number and tell you they will text you when your table is ready.  We confirmed we would be sitting at the bar while waiting. At the bar we were not in ear-shot, which was apparently a no-no. We were told that were calling our name out in waiting area for a "long time".   By the time they decided to actually text us and we went to get our seat, they had given away our table because we did not respond to the verbal calling of our name.  Finally the table service...again, friendly, but not very good service.  My order ended up on someone else's bill and it took a while for it to be corrected.  The food did arrive quickly and was very tasty, but the overall experience was just not good.  I will not be back.

Visited last Friday, burgers are great, unlimited fries, excellent service.  Only downside, Washington street location can be difficult to navigate, heading south no left turn into parking lot, when leaving only right turn onto Washington street.  Other then that, can't wait to go back!

I like Red Robin in general because of the vegan burger option. I also like that you can get it wrapped in lettuce or open faced (half bun) for when I need something lighter. The signature salt that goes on the fries is so delish and you should definitely sprinkle it on (it has a touch of spice and sugar, so cool). This place is new so not that many customers especially with the construction junk still up but seriously go. It's a good solid place and a way better alternative to Applebee's and all those outdated places.

We just left the restaurant and were disappointed.  Although the server was nice she seem to have to many tables for her self.  Waited a while for a food and we asked for our shakes first and she told us there was only one bartender and she hadn't made them yet. The food was passable but I was expecting much better.   Fires are endless but they only give you about 4 or 5 to begin with. Don't think we'll go back better places to go.

Let's start with the food is 3.5 stars but the service is terrible.   We arrived at 2:00 pm on Saturday the 28th, to two hostess telling us it's a 25 minute wait when no one is barely there. The lady calls our name and we go to follow her. Then the guy hostess says no come with me. We asked for a booster they gave us a high chair then they changed it. So no communication between hostess on this slow day. Tables were dirty with dishes left on them. For being a newly opened restaurant management needs to get there staff in order. The front hostess guy on this day was very rude. When we were leaving I had asked for another coloring menu for my daughter and he looked at me like I had 5 heads and said we don't have those. I told him the kids menu ones he says this is all we have and I told him that's it. No thank you have a nice day or nothing just a rude look. Will not be returning back to this dirty restaurant with poor service. Will choose another Red Robin.

REVIEW: As our family used to say, "Well, we don't have to eat there again."  The cup of onion soup was laughable. 3" x 3" and about 3/4" deep. Mostly absorbed by the Parmesan toast in the "cup". Tepid temp.  Prime Chop Burger asked for a little pink as they say. No pink. Tasty burger but only warm. Didn't taste like it just came off the grille.  Sweet potato fries, no taste and cold upon arrival.  Did their little tableside electronic checkout so I could express my comments. Still left 20% tip, but for the service only.  Gave same feedback to the guy at the door. Not sure if he was a manager. I probably should've made sure. I don't picture myself coming back here.

Met my GF after work. A lot of yelp reviews are about bad service. Kathleen was our server. She was delightfull and efficient. Hopefully just opening blues. I got a burger, she got a chicken sandwich. Both were cooked perfect and were very good. It's a huge restaurant. If you like burgers and beer. Try it out!

This Red Robin is disgusting. It's extremely dirty. Our water glasses had dirty finger prints on them, our plates had smudges of other food (apart from the burgers we ordered), our utensils had crusted food on them, when we asked for replacements we were given MORE dirty utensils. The booth itself had crusty food.  I've worked as a server, mind you, so I give all the passes, but this location is ridiculous.  I am from Seattle and am used to accessing that authentic Red Robin deliciousness and honey, this wasn't that.  Apart from the filth, the burgers were over salted.  I'm never coming back to this location, it's close, but no thanks. Go to the one in NH, y'all.
no taste in a $14 burger, and not cooked right either? 5 guys blows them away for half price. don't waste your time!

The staff was amazing, the food was as expected but the restaurant setup is TERRIBLE.  We ate at the bar however people also pickup takeout from the bar.  While we were eating, people waiting for or placing takeout orders were hovering around in the way.  Theres no place for them to walk up to a register either so people have to squeeze between bar patrons to place or pickup takeout orders.  It was annoying. There were even people waiting for takeout orders sitting in chairs at the bar totally preventing the bartenders from making any money.  There was a line of people at the door waiting for a table and people were regularly glancing over to the bar looking for open seats.  Id be pissed if I learned people sitting at the bar taking chairs wernt even being served. Management needs to move takeout service away from the bar and put it at the front door or at least designate an area for it. In the meantime they should also prevent people waiting for takeout from sitting at the bar.   Also I saw a waiter servicing tables who was touching all the straws on the end you put your lips on as he put them into drinks. His hands were touching the bar, serving tray, the door into the kitchen and he even wiped his sweaty forehead and then touched more straws.  This was absolutely foul.

If you have read any of my other reviews, you know I am not a fan of chain restaurants.  And unfortunately, Red Robin is very much a chain restaurant.   I have been here twice now with the family.  The second time, for my daughter, who really enjoyed her meal (specifically the milkshake) the first time we were here.  However, the second time, they were OUT OF ICE CREAM.  This seems like a very simple ingredient for a restaurant to be out of, especially one that prides itself on its milkshakes. The burgers are bland and super greasy.  The fries are soggy.  Half our silverware was dirty.  And they are always out of something basic.  Service is slow.  (They encourage you do use those tabletop kiosks, which I am not a fan of, again.)  The ambiance is terrible.  I don't know if this is the typical set up for a Red Robin, but to me, the entire restaurant feels very unwelcoming and industrial.   You'll enjoy your burger much better if you hit a local spot (WuBurger!) and support our home-town business owners, rather than a big corporation.

One star as it's the minimum required to write a review. The staff there is awful. They were short staffed since few people called in sick, which is fine. But instead of people trying to pick up the slack, half the restaurant was empty and they had about 20 people waiting for a table and 3 hostesses at the front, while two other staff members were standing in a corner chatting. I understand people getting sick and being short staffed, and sympathize with that. But let your customers know the situation and at least try to be more efficient. Ended up walking out as they really didn't seem to care.

So the good news is I found a parking spot out front. After that it was downhill from there. The waitress we had in the bar area was very nice. We ordered our burgers and she brought the fries out first (they were lukewarm) I thought that was odd but thank god because it took 10 more minutes before the Burgers showed up. So there was a lot of discussion about how we would want our burgers cooked and I said I want mine medium rare and she said OK you want a warm pink center right yes that's correct. It shows up and it was beat to death... over cooked, tasted terrible the thing that really pisses me off is that they charge $15 for this supposedly gourmet burger. I have a tip for you. You can go to Bancroft in Burlington and pay $15 for a REAL burger that tastes awesome and they cook it to order. So if your looking for an over priced over cooked burger with a side of room temperature fries...this is your place!!
Food is good. Burger was juicy and tasty. Same as the chicken. But service.. Friendly but extremely slow. Place was empty so don't much excuse for that.

Great burgers. Service is terrible. We walked in and had to wait for the hostess to finish chatting with a co-worker before she acknowledged us. Wait staff is friendly but needs serious improvement. Manager was nowhere to be found. Disappointing.

Been to other one and was fine with them. Woburn on the other hand was horrendous. First the place was a mess, floor was filthy and in trained staff. The waitress brought us plates that were already used from another table. Even saying these plates are sticky. She left and I brought them back with just a confused look. My daughter went back and hair was in her food. Forgive me I just threw up in my mouth writing this

Have been four times now. Service in the bar area is always good, better once you get used to ordering apps, drinks and paying with the tablets on the table. The food however is way overpriced. Last visit we got an app of plain Tortilla chips,  3 burgers , 2 cokes and a water- $70.00 with tip. The burgers are only slightly above average and only because of the toppings they offer, mine were always over cooked. Definitely not worth the money. For a place that charges premium $$$ for a burger and a 6 page burger menu, I expect way better.

This place needs better management, especially with the hiring department.  I don't know how or why they hired that rude hostess with the dyed purple hair but she obviously isn't qualified for the job.  She has no manners, is not friendly and can't navigate the seating chart properly.  It was 6:30PM and dark out yet she thought it was ok to wear sunglasses inside too, hungover?  Your dining experience begins and ends with the front and they fumbled that horribly.  It was clear that a lot of their workers are just there to collect an easy check and couldn't care less about the customer which is a shame since the food is not bad.

This is not a good restraunt,  Burger is just ok, thin unlike photo in menu. Server was inattentive. Not the cleanest place. Up charge if you want to upgrade to onion rings but offer endless fries?  Entertainment charge for trivia game. Not clearly marked (black lable on black device) impossible to see.????. Fast food that has a bar. I don't do fast food but Burger King/ Macdonalds are better. For $12.00 dollar burgers expected much better. Wont give this place a 2nd thought.

I haven't been to a Red Robin in years! The last time was in Daytona and it struck me then, as it does now, a cross between TGIFridays and Fudruckers. Known for its extensive burger offerings, I brought my daughter and her friend on a Tuesday night to this new location. Plenty of parking and conveniently located right off 128. We got there at 630pm and it was much more crowded than I was expecting. We were sat quickly and the kids immediately started playing with the wedge on the table. Our waiter came over quickly to take our drink order and was extremely patient with 2 13 year olds trying to decide on apps. We ordered a salted caramel shake, berry lemonade, fried pickles, fried zucchini sticks and fried cheese curds to start. It came out quickly and they were delicious. For dinner we had a chicken avo-cabo salad (cute name, huge salad), a bruchetta chicken sandwich and a double stack burger. All were enjoyed - particularly the salad. The steak fries were ok, not a huge hit. They are bottomless, but we didn't want or need more. Paying at the wedge on the table was super quick and easy. Lots of fun rubic cube decor and lots to keep kids of all ages occupied. Not going to be a regular go to place, but it is a good option.

Not impressed at all. The restaurant itself screams of "corporate model" from the walls to the menus. The food was uninspired and lifeless.  Basically this place is a polished Burger King with table service, a larger menu of frozen/previously cooked items, and a liquor license.  Service is almost identical between both restaurants as well.

Poorly managed, inept kitchen staff. It took over a half hour from order to getting food and it was not right! A simply patty melt and they could not get the order right - no onions on it when that is a key part of the patty melt. They need better management and better staff in kitchen How hard is it to get simple burgers right when that is your specialty. This should be negative stars,they did not even earn the 1 star.

We have been there twice.  I wish I could rate this place higher, because the location, decor, atmosphere, etc. is great.  Main problem is the service, and the level of training of the crew.  The first time was right after they opened, and that could be explained.  But three months later, we were seated but ignored, nobody could figure out whose table we were, and they confused the order.  And the dining room wasn't crowded (several empty tables), so there was time to take our order.  The menu is good, and the presentation of the food (mostly high-end burgers) is good.  But the staff really needs adult supervision!

This newbie to our hood has ample parking over a town eyesore (bonus points if you know what I'm talking about). Although I have a slight issue with a burger place being full serve. Five Guys and all those that have followed have done an outstanding job with the quick serve cow patty concept. Order, get it within about 5 minutes and grab a table.   I do like RR burgers but there are so many flaws with service here and others I have been to. One time, it took 20 minutes to be waited on. Another, the waitress disappeared for 10 minutes before returning with my credit card. It's this annoying pace that gets on my nerves for the Woburn location. Others visits, it was the lack of communication between bussers and our waitress. Some random person brought over the fries early like I asked but then the waitress shows up with the same thing a few minutes later.  The food itself has always been well prepared, flavorful and brings me back. We have loved our drinks, from the pineapple pina colada style smoothie to the shakes. I am in love with the "prime chophouse" burger and dont ever have problems with their silly jargon on how it's cooked. But they need to get the concept of actually having someone serve you one-on-one down to a science before it becomes an afterthought and we go elsewhere. I don't pay a burger premium here to deal with these flaws.  I'm pulling for them as I would for any place in Woburn but months later the kinks should be worked out. Please have your service finally match the pretty decor.

I'm just giving them 1 Star for the decent food. Me and my gf went here last Sunday (26/Mar) and the only good thing about this place was the plentiful parking.  So this late Sunday afternoon we were craving a burger, so I remember there is a red Robin open near by. Now I was thinking, I've been to the one in Patriot place, and that one was fine, this should be ok. Boy was I wrong. We should have went to fuddruckers like I originally was thinking, or even wuburger.  So we get there and it takes about 5 mins to be acknowledged, as we were 1 group of people standing in the reception area by what felt like some guy who could care less that we were there. He seats us in a mostly empty dining room at these​ high back chairs, which were kind of comfy.  A manager comes over and takes our drink order and app order after we have been sitting there for about 15 mins. Another 10 mins later she comes back with our drinks, and we order our burgers. I got the black and bleu, my gf got the patty melt. Now before our food came out, a new waitress and not the original woman came over and confirmed our order, which I thought was weird, however she was our waitress. The burgers were decent, fries were kind of hot, but not really crispy. Very meh food.  It took another 10 mins for the app to come out, then probably 20 for the burgers to come out. At this point, we haven't seen our waitress at all. After she confirmed our order she disappeared. We finished our food and sat there for another 15 mins as she never checked on us one time, until she noticed we had finished at some time. She never asked how the food was she just said if your paying by card you pay on the kiosk, and she removed our plates and walked off.  Look I get it, your a burger joint, it's not supposed to be super attentive service, however that's not how you operate a sit down restaurant. With that terrible level of service I doubt I will ever patronize another red Robin again. If I wanted better service, I would have went to fuddruckers, at least there I know the food is good, and everything else is self serve.

4/7/17 Friday night. Know your busy. But....got a seat right away, good when you are in a wheelchair. Then waited, & waited, & waited for our server. Finally James stopped by. Took our drink orders, app & food orders. Drinks came right away (a strawberry & a chocolate monster shakes, my hubby & I swap the metal tins so we each get both), the app came in a reasonable time. Our dinner, well, we waited, & waited. Then James comes with them & said "this is what happened guys". All the blame on the kitchen. We ate our meal, decided to pay cash & had to find James. We turned on the 'call server' light. We waited & waited, the table next to ours had theirs on too. He stopped there then ran away, came back a few minutes later with their food. Left. Then came back, to us. WE told him we wanted to pay cash, he said he'd get our check. And we waited & waited. The manager came over to see what we wanted as he hadn't turned off the 'call server' light & we didn't know how. We told her we were waiting on our check. James finally gave it to us & left. After waiting again, turning on the call server light again, he never came back. So, we used our debit card to pay & got the heck out of there. I know Friday nights are busy (we won't come again on Friday night), but, every time we saw James he had another story on how the kitchen was screwing up, & he had had to have a conversation with the manager about it. I do know that if he is on the next time we go in, & we are seated with him as our server, we will be asking to be moved to another server. Nice guy my husband is, he tipped him. I wouldn't have. So, I wrote this instead. The manager helped us get me & the chair out the doors, we said nothing. Just wanted to go home. We love you Red Robin, but, hope this isn't a trend. Just a fluke. We have been to the new Red Robin in Woburn twice since it opened. 12/20/16 and 12/23/16. We have been to the ones in Nashua, Salem, Manchester (all NH) and Foxboro. Now Woburn, what a great Christmas Present! I found an app for my phone that lets me customize any of my burgers, anyway I want it. So, took it with me the first time we went. When ordering I just handed her the phone. It came perfect. Warning, they are still shaking down, so if you dont want your burger quite pink inside, say NO PINK. Then it will have just a bit.  The garlic fries are to die for. Both times we went to this Red Robin we were served a much larger serving of fries than at any of the other ones. Never needed another serving  here in Woburn, got more than enough.  Our servers have been right on with us right away. Very helpful, and friendly. The second time it was crowded and we were told 45 minutes. But, I am in a wheelchair, and they offered us a wheelchair accessible spot at the bar counter. We had a fun floor show to watch while eating. Food was terrific, people terrific, and after watching them make about 25 shakes while we were there I got a chocolate milk shake to go for dessert. Its mostly self serve and tastes wonderful! Will definately be making this place our place to go here in Woburn. Will save us a lot of gas treking up to NH to one of the other Red Robins.  Only problem is that during rush hour we live on the wrong side of Woburn to get there easily.   Oh well, cant have everything.   Been a few more times. I understand that at other burger places the toppings are put on because the beef has no flavor. These do. I've started ordering them Naked, on an onion bun, that's it. The beef is so flavorable toppings take away from the good taste of the meat. But, I'm older & have actually tasted good beef before, the younger generations have been raised on dump stuff on the burger, maybe they won't notice the no flavor of the beef. There is an app out there called the Customizer, You can build your burger or anything else exactly how you want it. Like the Baja Dressing with the taco chips, you can skip it, & put the dressing on the burger. We have never been shorted on the bottomless fries, whatever flavor we get (usually garlic), at other Red Robin's we have gotten second orders, in Woburn, always more than we can eat. Maybe it's not how friendly the server is, but, how friendly we are. They have been bringing small baskets of different kinds of fries out as free apps lately.  If it is those that you think are small, well, they are free. Sort of, see how you like it. Like any establishment there are some great servers, some good servers, & a couple who would be better off in another kind of job. It is kinda expensive. But, it is so above all the other burger places around that it is our go to place for a nice burger dinner, to relax, not hurry. Now, if it would just start delivering.

The food the incredible!! We had the buffalo wings for the appetizer (so good!). Tried 2 different burgers that were undoubtedly 2 of the best burgers I have ever had (I've had a lot). For desert, the donut tower was really good too! The more fluffiest melt-in-your-mouth donuts ever!   Service was really slow but, the waitress was friendly. They need to hire more staff as it seemed too busy for them to handle. Food came out wicked late and the waitress kept getting confused and forgetting our drink order every time.

Talk about bad service!! Went for the first time last night to get a good burger, boy was I wrong. First when we walked in it did feel like we weren't acknowledged at all and there was no one else waiting, very strange. Once we were seated our waitress came over and explained she is new, which was fine. After about 10 minutes we received our drinks and our waitress kept saying take your time and disappeared for another 15 minutes. Finally our burgers came and they were disgustingly dripping wet, the meat honestly did not even taste real but after all that long wait I was so hungry I quickly ate some. Our burgers were around 15$ each, and we barely ate them. Mind you I did not have a water the entire time I was eating, the waitress was cleaning tables and doing other things, not prioritizing correctly at all!!!! Total disappointment, if your looking for a gourmet burger do not go here!!!

Great food. Awful service. First of all, we walked in only to be seated to a table that wasn't even wiped down. The host went to get a rag and came back and proceeded to only wipe down half the table and not the seats. What did she expect us to sit and eat in someone else's crumbs? Simply disgusting. Now i've been waiting here for 30 minutes with a dirty empty plate and an empty glass of water waiting for a refill and a milkshake. We turned on the Call Waitress setting on the kiosk table on our table and of course... no response from our waitress. Absolute worst service i have ever experienced, the help ignored us so badly. Even though the food was good, the service was so poor i will never be back here again.

Worst food I've had at a restaurant in a really long time.  I have no problem with chains (99, etc.), but this was horrible! Guacamole was brown and had a random wilted mandarin orange in it. Boneless chicken wings tasted like Wendy's and had poutine curds sprinkled all over them... Disgusting and server didn't bother to ask why we didn't eat.

We took the family. The kids love it here. Bottomless everything. You can pay $1 to play games on a device at your table. In a way it's nice because it's a built in babysitter...  the food is nothing special. Burgers and fries. It is a favorite of my kids so we will be back again, and again.

The only reason I'm giving this a 1 star is because our waiter Joe was awesome. That's were it stops. The appetizers were not the quality I expected. You hear nothing but great things about Red Robin and this location seems to be just going through the motions. Two burgers from the people I was with were both ordered medium, but both cooked completely different. The buns were greasy and soggy. The endless fries were gross. They weren't cooked thoroughly through.  This is a place I won't return to or recommend. Should've listened to the family coming out the door when we were coming in as they were telling us don't order the burgers. Which is pretty sad considering it says gourmet burgers on the building!

I have been to the restaurant 3 times in two weeks. Every time, the burgers were not prepared correctly. The wait staff was excellent, very attentive, recording every detail of the order.  Unfortunately, the kitchen made 4 out of 5 burgers either incorrectly​ cooked or with incorrect condiments. The managers were also very accommodating, removing items from the bill and offering free deserts.  I explained that I just wish they could produce what was ordered. The location is new so I will try again in a few months.  If Red Robin reads this review, please, please have someone verify orders are prepared correctly. You have good food and staff in the dinning room.
Horrible !! Worst burgers I have ever had. New place and its dirty. Went to Red Robin in PA and it was awesome. Never here !
Delicious food, comfortable seating, nice music that didn't drown out conversation, and our server Janet was a hoot! Love the sweet potato fries, and the burgers were fabulous. We'll be back, Janet!

Earlier this week, as I looked forward to Memorial Day weekend, I pictured myself trying out a new restaurant, perhaps with a patio bar and lobster. However, I left lunch choice to a friend and ended up at Red Robin. I typically do not review chains, but this place was disappointing so here I am to keep Corporate America on its toes.  To make matters worse, this chain's specialty, burgers, was certainly not what I was craving today. So, I dug myself an even deeper hole and ordered a salad. Disclosure: I have eaten at another Red Robin location in the past and did try a burger. It was decent, but didn't wow me enough to come back to an RR until today, a whole two years later and not by choice. I could sum this whole experience up with one phrase "It is what it is," but you all know my reviews never take shortcuts.  The "Avo-Cobb-O" looked to be the most promising. I mean, bleu cheese and bacon can hide just about anything right? Well, not gritty lettuce. I'm not positive of its source, but there was definitely a gritty, sandy texture I kept sensing and I believe it was from the lettuce. This salad has so much potential, but was a big disappointment. Lots of great ingredients, but they don't come together quite right. Also, I'm taking off a half star for making me say that silly name while ordering.  The menu is typical chain fare. There is a selection of burgers, sandwiches, wraps- probably your best bet. Entrees include chicken, steak, and salmon dishes. I hesitate to order such entrees at a restaurant like this because I know they will be hit or miss. The menu also offers some fun non-alcoholic beverages and there is a full bar as well. Starters include soup, chili, and a few pub style appetizers. There is a kid's menu and desserts. We ordered some guac, salsa and chips to start, but the portion was very small and disappointing. Something for everyone here at Red Robin, but to me it's all just glorified fast food.  The atmosphere is bright and trendy. There is a large bar area on one side and TV's in both the bar and dining room. I think being able to watch the Sox game was the highlight of today's visit. I thought our table for two was very small. I strategically moved plates and cups to make room for the appetizer.  I liked our server, Janet. She was very friendly and attentive. Janet brought me a couple different salad dressings to try, which I thought was a nice gesture. She also told me she liked my shoes - winning!  My friend and I have different tastes/standards in food and that's okay. Sometimes a quick burger may be just what you're looking for, but I think there are so many better choices in the area. I'm still dreaming of that patio bar and lobster.

Getting seated was a bit of an issue. There was a line out the door but many tables were empty inside. Most were still covered in dirty dishes and all were missing chairs.  Once seated, I was again surprised by the state of the dining room. We were surrounded by dirty dishes on empty tables, chairs tipped on their backs, and dirty napkins strewn about the floor. For the entirety of our meal.  Our waitress was as attentive as she could be; but was obviously over-extended. Bussing tables, refilling drinks, taking orders and delivering food to basically the entire dinning room is too much for one person to handle.  The overall experience wasn't great. Staff was stretched too thin to even make it feel like a clean environment; let alone getting adequate service. We were constantly looking for our waitress but I can't blame her for being left with such inadequate/non-existent help.  Food was above average overall but I don't think I'd really like to come back.

Meh... Typical chain. En par with the 99. All the previous reviews are accurate; I wish I had read them before going. Perhaps they are still in launch mode; I would give them a second chance but not any time soon.

The takeout services here are terrible.. I wish I checked yelp reviews before I ordered take out.. their "mighty" Caesar was about 20 pieces of romaine with 4/5 sad slices of chicken and two small pieces of toasted bread which I had to ask for..

Perfectly average and exactly what one would expect from a national chain restaurant experience. Red Robin was outfitted with all the new IPad like gaming devices that can also be used to order food. I consider myself a burger expert and thought these were pretty decent but at the end of the day not memorable. Falls into the category of, would definitely return but in no hurry to rush back. Also got to try one of their boozy milkshakes, very tasty but couldn't imagine getting drunk off of a bunch of them.
The service was not great I am not sure if they are new or what but they need to pay more attention to what is going on we had no silver ware,napkins or got drink refills not happy

First time at a Red Robin and what a disappointment! The burgers were mediocre at best and way overpriced for the quality. I got a burger with a fried egg and American cheese. The burger had bits of bone and gristle in it, which was very unpleasant. I asked for the burger well-done and I got it medium. The burger and the egg were way over-salted and that saltiness overpowered any flavor from the beef or the egg. It really was terrible. The American cheese was a "cheese product" that they use because it gets melty fast but again, is oversalty. It reminded me of the cheese at McDonald's. I was looking forward to the unlimited fries, but alas, another disappointment. They are just frozen steak fries that they dole out in tiny portions, though they are unlimited. The first batch I got was warm, not hot and OK for the frozen potato genre. For the money and the hype, I expected much, much better. They need a better quality burger that won't kill you with bones and gristle, and fresh potato steak fries, not frozen Then they could justify charging $12 for a burger. Really, this was way overrated and a huge disappointment.

The good: friendly and mildly attentive wait staff  The very bad: not sure what the back end of house and the cooks do other than screw up orders. I have been to this location at least 4 times and have NEVER correctly received an order. Mine is usually wrong and this is asking for minor things like adding bacon or no tomatoes.  I have also seen my friends orders get messed up VERY BADLY. We were once sent home with someone else's half eaten leftovers rather than the new burger we were supposed to get because they messed up his lunch while we were there.  I'd avoid at all costs. There are better places to get a burger.

Please fix this place or close it. Was dead at lunch and still took forever to get food. Way to much $$$ for average burgers. Like five guys on steroids but with twice the cost and poor service. Please management notice you are dead at lunch in a very busy business area. Everyone I have asked says the same thing. Too long a wait and average food at high prices. Most like me went once to see how it was and like me will not go back.

Just bizarre....We were seated in the middle of an almost empty dining room, between 2 tables: a dirty one and at the other, an employee taking his break....Our waitress took approx. 10-15 mins to greet us.  Our drinks took about 15 mins to get to the table and when they finally did, my boyfriend was given a dirty glass to pour his beer into.  We ordered our food and that took another 30 mins.  When we finally got our burgers delivered to us (by a food runner or backwaiter not our waitress), our waitress was no where to be found and continued to hide during our ENTIRE meal.  We had finished eating and stacked our empty plates at the edge of the table to try and give some indication that we wanted to leave. My boyfriend then tells me to turn around and we see her walking in the FRONT door from her cigarette break.... She came to our table and said: "Oh thank God you finally got your burgers," took the dirty plates and walked away.......We paid on the kiosk at our table and as we were leaving the host didn't say a word....lt like I was in the twilight zone the entire time I was there.  Literally the most ridiculous experience I've ever had at a restaurant.

What a waste of Prime Real Estate.  Who runs out of chardonnay at 6p on a Monday night?  This is the second time I've been here and the second time no wine.  Service was horrible and the restaurant is disgustingly dirty.  I'm not sure who's running the place, but he or she needs to be retrained or replaced.

I love Red Robin but I was so disappointed. I was sitting there for over fifteen minutes waiting for my waiter to come introduce him/herself and take my drink order. I ended up leaving and told the manager. I really was looking forward to my meal but the service ruined my experience

Wow! Gourmet Burger?????  First I visited on a Sunday Night around 6 pm.. Not busy at all... I sat at the bar.... The bar was very clean and the bartender was friendly enough... Long story short I would not go back.. The bread was to large for the very small burger.. The burger had no taste and I  asked for med rare and I would say it was med well.... Also the relish mayo they put on the cheese burger was drowning the poor burger... I honestly could not taste the burger.... Way to much mayo.. The sweet potatoe fries where burnt and cold and I think they were probably sitting under the hot lamp all day... or they were frozen.... horrible... Sorry wanted to like this place but would not go back.... to many good burger places around...

Food was good, cob salad, turkey burger, 2 good size kids meal. Kids meal came out wrong and we ended up taking it to go. Was told it would be taken off the bill, it was not. Had to remind them. Be aware, you are responsible for ordering your food and paying your check via a table top computer. Waited forever for our check until we were told how to pay for it. Handed the waitress 40.00 for a 28.59 bill. She asked me "how much do you want back?" I said, the bill is 28.59, I'll have all my change (I had her tip on the table". She again asked, so how much do you want back? Finally she said I'll give you change for a twenty. I literally had to leave her the exact amount. At which point she asked again, "do you want change". Thought I was being punked.  Won't go back anytime soon.

My boyfriend and I wanted to try Red Robin.  The service was terrible, our server fir got to put in our food order and people who arrived after were getting food.  My boyfriends burger was supposed to be pink but it was well done.  We asked for more fries and the server forgot to get then.  We will never go back to Red Robin!

Came back after I visited right after it opened and things have come around.  Judy is a new person behind the bar and she is really nice and attentive.  I really hated this place and vowed never to come back and gave it another chance, I am glad I did.  Good job making this Red Robin up to standard.  I will come back again now.
Too bad there is not a choice for less than 1 star. Rude staff, dirty restaurant, and the food is disgusting. For the Woburn location, Red Robin......yuck not mmmmm......
Came to get buffalo wings and was told they were all out of wings...boneless and with bone...on a football Sunday?

Gourmet?  Not a chance. Stick to the Nines aka 99 bar and grill.  Burgers and sides are tastier and vaster variety.  This place is an up charge for everything.  Burgers way overpriced.  Went 3 times to see if I would change my mind and each time my bill was higher and food was worse.  I don't think it should cost $55 for an adult and child to eat dinner without any specialty or alcoholic beverages.

We have been wanting to check out a RR.  We figured we would give them a few months to settle in.  The food was decent.  My wife and I got burgers.  We also got an app.  It was good chips with some kind of pulled pork. The real problem was the service.  They had two waiters in our area.  They needed at least three.  The waiter we had was a male in his twenties.  I have no idea how this kid made it through an interview.  He was nice enough but he should of been waiting tables.  No dishes for the apps, 20 minutes for a beer, had to ask repeatedly for water.  The other patrons were having similar experiences.  The bad part is if the service had been better we would have had more drinks and dessert.  We might try a different RR but not that one.  It's too bad because they are new to this area and it left a bad first impression.

When this place first opened, the food and service was great, and that's why we kept coming. This is my third time here with my family and I have to say, the service sucks and the burgers are average. The place has been going downhill. The service has not improved at all. We walk into the place and we wait there for 10 minutes before being seated, every time we are here. While waiting, the place has a ton of empty tables and we wonder why we have to wait. That question was answered;  we had to wait for 10 minutes at the door because the waiter/host had to clean off the tables so he could seat us. That's just ridiculous!!! All the tables are dirty and piled high with plates. The floor is also covered with dirty napkins.  It makes me wonder what the waiter/ host was doing at the door when we walked in (nothing).  As we wait another 10 minutes at the table deciding what to order, we look around and see other customers giving looks to each other. The looks are for the server and the place because the kitchen managed to mess up their order. I saw this at every table around me. My question is, what are the cooks doing back there? Mind you, as we wait a little longer, we were deciding whether or not we should leave too.  When the food finally came out, they managed to mess my burger up. My mom and I ordered the same burger and hers was made correctly, but it was missing the tortilla chips. I ate like half the burger to realize that I was missing a lot of stuff, way different than my mom's burger. My burger was missing the tortilla chips, the salsa, and the guacamole on the top bun. My thought is, how could they possibly make the sandwich wrong?! With the long wait, and the wrong order, it is not worth it to return to this place for the price we pay.  For a "gourmet" burger joint, the burgers are over priced and are average. I don't think I would come again if it wasn't for our free gourmet birthday burgers. If you want to come with family, I advise you to plan ahead and have patience for the service you will receive.

Food wasn't good, my waitress was great at trying, but place was dirty, I was misled by the hostess to get gift cards to pay for my bill and get free movie tickets, but couldn't use it the same day of activation... many issues with this place. They need to pull their act together.

If I could have given a NEGATIVE STAR I would have.   I went there for lunch with a party of 3.   We waited 10 minutes even though the place was empty and then they sat a party of 6 who came in afterwards  Generally a fan of Red Robin, but we will never go back to this one again.

Ordered a black and blue burger that was suppose to have blue cheese crumbles on it. When I got it I looked at it and it have 3 crumbles total so I asked the waitress for more crumbles and she was super nice but the chef told her that that was the only amount he could give me so I said okay then I'm not going to pay for the up change then and ya that did not go over well!! Long story they were very rude and the food isn't even that good!!

First time here and we were lucky to have an amazing waiter named Lauren or Laura(sorry girl) but she was so great. She's always checking on us making sure we had our french fries, just making our stay there awesome. I couldn't finish my huge shake (the reg size and then the shake that comes in a tin cup) and the left over became watery,  she got me a new one. Little stuff like that makes me smile because I was going to leave it there. I didn't want to complain about it since it was my fault that I couldn't finish my amazing shake. But she thought about it for me. From beginning to end we had such a great experience. The burgers are so delicious and the unlimited french fries are amazing.

Not exactly sure what this is. (Pic of Mac and cheese) My husband and I both ordered one with our take out and it's absolutely horrific. This is not at all what the menu shows and it's not cheesy at all. Also, we arrived before the food was put together and when we got it- everything was cold. The arctic cod sandwich was good and the burger was ok - if it didn't have quac it would've been tasteless and the sweet potato fries were rubbery and ice cold. Not at all worth 40 dollars. I could've gotten a better meal at burger king. 2nd photo: I asked for no onion strings - really?

Let me say upfront that my feelings about this particular Red Robin. The burger selection is extensive and the one I had (Burning Love) was delicious. Fries were good too and my wife liked her bleu cheeseburger. The place - on a Saturday night - was quite lively with a lot of families with kids. The service was ok, if slow. Our server was nice but came back about 10 minutes after we ordered to double-check what we wanted. I thought that was odd. She also asked us if we wanted more French Fries long after we were done eating. It also took her a while to come back and pick up the check. Fortunately, we weren't in any particular hurry. That's the good news. Now, I posted a couple of pictures which I hope come through. But let me say this: this is the dirtiest restaurant I've ever eaten in. I'm a businessman and I travel and eat in a lot of restaurants. I've seen cleaner Chuck E. Cheeses.  Right next to me on the floor the whole time we were there was a pile of popcorn and, maybe, french fries. Likewise there was a similar pile across from me next to a table. There WAS a manager there. He came out (once) to help push tables together, completely overlooking the receipt on the floor and the pile of popcorn and french fry right next to him. I realize the place was busy but that's no excuse for him not to send someone out with a broom. (Or do it himself.) No excuses. This guy's not competent to be a restaurant manager. Despite this will I go back? Yes, I'll go again on a Saturday night. If it's the same, I won't bother with Yelp but will send a note directly to the CEO. Total BS, no excuses for laziness and slovenliness. Especially in a restaurant.

Our first Red Robin experience was not so pleasant, We were not greeted nor treated well, the service was horrible. It took 15 minutes to be seated in an empty restaurant, the food was average and the servers attitude was as distasteful as the soggy fries I was served. However, we decided to give it a second chance. This experience was much better, not because the food wasn't mediocre anymore, (fries were still soggy) but because of our amazingly attentive and friendly server Jean! You are the last of a dying breed the exceptional level of friendly professionalism, mannerisms and anticipation of needs you displayed is what ever server should aspire to provide. Everyone should be trained by her!! Although we probably won't be back cause the food just isn't up to par I had to come a give jean a shout out cause she deserves it!

Management issue here. Love the ads on tv. Even love the food from the one time I went two months ago. Tonight no hostess and people waited ten minutes and left with no seats. I went back and asked for help. Manager came out and sat us but could care less. Horrible attitude so we left.

Ate here last night and had a great meal again.  Bar area was packed and place was very busy in general, however, our waitress was always available and we waited for nothing.  Everyone enjoyed their meals, we had the new chicken tenders app as well, and portion size was large and I absolutely loved it.  Overall, excellent meal!

Good food but LOUSY service. Waitress brought the wrong order to our table TWICE!!! Slow service even not many people around!! The bathroom is nasty!!! Splashed of urines on the toilet seats and NO toilet paper!!! Very upsetting!!! Not recommended to go there!
